translations.translation: each self will know what it has sent ahead and left behind.
Each soul will know what it had sent ahead and what it had left behind.
everyone shall know all his deeds, both the earlier and the later.
every soul will see the result of its deeds - those recorded before his death and those which will produce either virtue or evil after his death.
Every soul will come to know what it has sent ahead and what it left behind.
A person will know what he has sent forward and left behind.
Every soul shall know what it has sent before and held back.
then a soul shall know its works, the former and the latter.
A soul will know what it hath sent before (it) and what left behind.
then everyone will know what he has sent ahead, and what he has left behind.
Each soul shall know that which it sent afore and that which it left behind.
then a soul shall know what it has sent ahead and left behind.
(Then) shall each soul know what it hath sent forward and (what it hath) kept back.
(Then) a person will know what he has sent forward and (what he has) left behind (of good or bad deeds).
the soul shall know what it has done, the former and the latter.
Each soul will know what it has advanced, and what it has deferred.
A soul will [then] know what it has put forth and kept back.

[82:5] a soul, every soul, will know, at the time of the [occurrence of the] things mentioned, which is the Day of Resurrection, what it has sent ahead, in the way of deeds, and, what [it has], left behind, of these and did not do.

(A soul) every soul at that point (will know what it hath sent before (it)) of good or evil (and what left behind) of good or evil wont; it is also said this means: it will know the acts of obedience it offered and those it missed.

commentaries.author: زيد بن علي
commentaries.text:
وقوله تعالى: { عَلِمَتْ نَفْسٌ مَّا قَدَّمَتْ وَأَخَّرَتْ } معناه افترضَ الله عَليها
 ويقال: ما قَدّمتْ: من خَيرٍ
 وما أخّرتْ: معناه مما افترضَ من سُنةٍ استَنَ بها مَنْ بَعدَهُ

translations.translation:
And His saying, {Allāh has ordained for every person his share of death} [means that] He has decreed death for him.


It is said: "What you have done is from the best."
 And what you have deferred: its meaning is what one has assumed from a practice that those after him have adhered to.

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text:
{ عَلِمَتْ } يومئذٍ { نَفْسٌ مَّا قَدَّمَتْ } في نشأة الاختبار والاعتبار من صوالح الأعمال
 ومحاسن الأخلاق والأطوار { وَأَخَّرَتْ } [الانفطار: 5] أهملت وتركت فيها منها


ثمَّ نادى سبحانه مظهر الإنسان
 المصور بصورة الرحمن بداءً معاتبةً وتخجيلاً على ما عرض عليه من الغفلة والنيسان
 مع أنه جُبل على فطرة التوحيد والعرفان
